title: Ticket #2260: Optional compression during file transfer
description:
Sometimes a user has some large input or output files that are easily compressed. Plain text is common. Compressing them over the wire would speed up transfers and reduce bandwidth usage; good for everyone. The cost in process time is minimal if zlib is set to use the lowest compression level (1 AKA Z_BEST_SPEED).

The current workaround is to compress the files manually, then teach your program to uncompress them or add a wrapper script to do the uncompression. Either option adds unnecessary complexity.

Proposal 1: Always enable compression during file transfer. If investigation shows that the CPU overhead is trivial, this will help users with compressible data at negligible cost to everyone else.

Proposal 2: if the CPU cost isn't negligible, allow users to toggle the option on a per job or perhaps per file basis.
